meanings.definition: A diuretic drug used to treat high blood pressure and fluid retention.
meanings.sent1: My doctor prescribed hydrochlorothiazide to help lower my blood pressure.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist explained how hydrochlorothiazide helps the body get rid of extra water.
meanings.sent3: After taking hydrochlorothiazide, I felt like a leaky faucet, constantly running to the bathroom.
meanings.sent4: The effect of hydrochlorothiazide was like a drain unclogging, releasing excess fluid from my body.
meanings.sent5: Hydrochlorothiazide acted like a sponge, soaking up the extra salt and water in my system.

meanings.definition: A medication that helps the kidneys remove excess salt and water from the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended hydrochlorothiazide to help my kidneys eliminate extra salt.
meanings.sent2: Taking hydrochlorothiazide made me feel lighter as my body shed excess water weight.
meanings.sent3: I joked that hydrochlorothiazide turned me into a human water filter, purifying my system.
meanings.sent4: The way hydrochlorothiazide worked was like a plumber fixing a pipe, clearing out the excess salt and water.
meanings.sent5: Hydrochlorothiazide was like a magic wand, waving away the extra salt and water from my body.
